results.title: Framing
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Lessons in visual language”.
Looks at the notion of the television camera putting a frame around the world. Discusses on-screen and off-screen space, real and apparent size, and the frame within the frame. Devised and narrated by Peter Thompson.

results.title: Frameworks in action: active learning
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Three teachers show their approach to “active learning” in areas of primary English, postprimary Mathematics and Drama. This is part of a series showing teachers and parents practical responses to the Frameworks approach.

results.title: Frame by frame: the art of animation
results.creator_credit: Jerry Samuelson, Paul Burnford, Paul Burnford Film Productions and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: This film explores the possibilities of making a frame-by-frame, or animated film. Illustrates a variety of frame-by-frame techniques: still-picture filming (kinestasis), flicker-framing, cut-out animation, people animation (pixillation), direct images on film, and time sequence filming. This film is suitable for upper secondary levels.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Jerry Samuelson, Paul Burnford, Paul Burnford Film Productions and Pyramid Films
